newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-FEYENOORD REACH THIRD ROUND DESPITE 1-0 DEFEAT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FEYENOORD REACH THIRD ROUND DESPITE 1-0 DEFEAT.

text.p: Dutch side Feyenoord, weakened by the absence of Ronald Koeman and Jean-Paul van Gastel, lost 1-0 to Espanyol of Spain but still reached the UEFA Cup third round on Tuesday.

A ninth minute strike by Arteaga, whose shot from 18 metres was defelected by a Feyenoord defender past goalkeeper Ed de Goey, gave Espanyol their second-leg victory on the night but Feyenoord took the tie 3-1 on aggregate.
Espanyol had most of the ball against an insecure Feyenoord team who missed the reliable defending of the suspended Koeman and the midfield organisation of van Gastel.
However, the Spanish side's impressive build-up was not matched by their work inside the box.

Feyenoord, defending a 3-0 away win, had the best chances to put the tie beyond any doubt early on. Henke Larsson, Pablo Sanchez and Giovanni van Bronckhort in the first half and Larsson and Gaston Taument in the second all failed to make the most of their opportunities.
Feyenoord coach Arie Haan said: "We can only be satisfied we reached the next round. We played one good game away and a lesser one here."
